example.eg: I need to measure the wood before I cut it. The player measured the distance to the goal.
example.egtrans: 在把木头切开之前，我需要测量它。球员估量了一下到球门的距离。

example.eg: He measured all of his options before acting.
example.egtrans: 在行动前，他权衡了所有的选择。

example.eg: The new president's success would always be measured against his predecessor's.
example.egtrans: 人们总是会把新任总统的成功和前任总统相比较。

example.eg: He tested his skill to see how he measures against the competition.
example.egtrans: 他考验了自己的技能，比较与竞争对手的实力。

example.eg: They use pounds as a measure in the USA.
example.egtrans: 在美国，人们使用磅作为一个度量单位。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 度量单位, 计量标准

example.eg: The litre is a liquid measure.
example.egtrans: 公升是量测液体的计量单位。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 计量制, 计量法, 计量单位

example.eg: This measure is necessary to ensure the safety of all employees.
example.egtrans: 这项措施对于确保所有员工的安全是很必要的。

example.eg: I have the measures of the room in my notebook.
example.egtrans: 我的笔记本里有屋子的尺寸。

example.eg: He had just a measure of curiosity about the subject.
example.egtrans: 他对这个话题有一点点好奇。

example.eg: The worker took out his measure before he started working.
example.egtrans: 开工前，工人拿出了他的测量工具。

example.eg: Our process is the best one, by any measure.
The measure of the court was 30 x 90 meters.
The measure was approved by the legislature.
example.egtrans: 该措施由立法机关批准。

example.eg: In English pubs, a standard measure of spirits is 25 ml.
example.egtrans: 在英国的酒吧，烈酒的基准量是25毫升。

example.eg: There are four crotchets per measure in 4/4 time.
The man measured the grain out into four equal portions.
He will never measure up; we might as well go ahead and fire him now.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 符合标准, 达到要求

example.eg: Rodgers has proved that he is capable of measuring up to the demands of the job.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 达到…的要求, 符合…的标准

example.eg: Go ahead and measure up the next ten boards to be cut.

dsense.name: measure [sb] up
dsense.guideword: (calculate size: for clothing) (为裁剪或购买衣服)

example.eg: The dress designer was measuring Brenda up.
Colin knew about the vacant position and was aware that his boss was measuring him up.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 无可估量, 无法衡量

example.eg: The government's counter-measures don't seem to be working.
I'd like a vodka, please, and make it a double.
Emily added an extra teaspoon of cinnamon to the recipe for good measure.
I asked for a gallon, and he gave me full measure.
Teaching people how to cook healthy meals is only a half-measure if they cannot afford the ingredients. It is not a time for half measures: we need radical change now.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不彻底的办法, 权宜之计, 折衷之策
在一定程度上, 有一点, 有几分

example.eg: The President's re-election chances are in great measure tied to the health of the economy.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 量身订制的，订制的，定做的

example.eg: During the cold war, Kennedy felt that it was imperative that the US meet Khrushchev's challenges, measure for measure.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 以牙还牙地, 一报还一报

dsense.name: measure [sb] up for [sth]
dsense.guideword: (calculate size: for clothing) (为裁剪或购买衣服)

example.eg: The tailor measured him up for a new suit.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 谨言慎行, 说话谨慎

example.eg: Some women use birth control pills as a preventive measure to avoid pregnancy.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 防护措施, 预防措施, 防治手段

example.eg: By studying people's actions you'll have the rough measure of their characters.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 粗略的测量, 大致测量

example.eg: Tailors and dressmakers use tape measures to take measurements for clothing.
A tourniquet is a temporary measure to stop bleeding until doctors can stitch up the wound.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 临时举措, 暂行措施
